text: It's the best marriage of songs and production. But I have to say, I have an affinity for Bossanova.
author: Joey Santiago

text: New Orleans, more than many places I know, actually tangibly lives its culture. It's not just a residual of life it's a part of life. Music is at every major milestone of our life: birth, marriage, death. It's our culture.
author: Wendell Pierce

text: Let me be clear. I support the definition of marriage as a union between a man and a woman.
author: Ben Nelson

text: I was glad to hear of that determination as I detest the practice of cousins marrying or any marriage between persons in which there can be traced the most distant relationship. I go for the improvement instead of the deterioration of our race.
author: Ezra Cornell

text: Marriage is all about knowing the ins and outs and the intimate details, and your wife is supposed to be the person you know best. But my brother and I think alike, know everything about one another, and when we get together, we block everything else out. Nothing exists in our world except for us.
author: Jon Heder
